LDAP Chai API

com.novell.ldapchai.provider
Enum ChaiSetting

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<ChaiSetting>
      com.novell.ldapchai.provider.ChaiSetting
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<ChaiSetting>
public enum ChaiSetting
extends Enum<ChaiSetting>

All settings for LDAP Chai used by ChaiConfiguration.

Each setting contains:

  • A key value useful in external configurations
  • A default value for the setting
  • A validator to ensure that an assocated value is syntactically correct

Author:
Jason D. Rivard
See Also:
ChaiConfiguration

Enum Constant Detail

BIND_URLS

public static final ChaiSetting BIND_URLS
A list of URLs to be used for ldap connections. validateValue(String) will be used to to ensure that each provided value is a valid URL.

Multiple ldap URLs can be specified by separating with a comma or space character.

A value that does not conform to URI.create(String) requirements or has a scheme other than "ldap" or "ldaps" will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

Examples
ldap://192.168.10.1
ldaps://192.168.10.2
ldaps://192.168.10.3:6322
ldap://host1.example.com:382
ldap://host1.example.com,ldaps://host2.example.com,ldaps://10.8.31.1:6322
ldaps://host1.example.com ldaps://10.8.31.1:6322

Unless FAILOVER_ENABLE is set to true, the use of values by a ChaiProvider beyond the first value is unspecified.

Key: chai.bind.URLs
Default: ldap://localhost

See Also:
FAILOVER_ENABLE

BIND_DN

public static final ChaiSetting BIND_DN
Set the bind DN to be used during connection establishment. If empty, an anonymous connection will be attempted. Valid values should be fully qualified ldap syntax, such as: 
 cn=administrator,ou=container,o=Organization

Key: chai.bind.dn
Default: (blank)

BIND_PASSWORD

public static final ChaiSetting BIND_PASSWORD
Password to use during chai LDAP bind. An empty password will cause an anonymous connection to be used.

Key: chai.bind.password
Default: (blank)

CACHE_ENABLE

public static final ChaiSetting CACHE_ENABLE
Enables ldap data caching. Calls to the provider will be cached and subsequent calls will be returned from memory instead of being fetched from the ldap server.

The wrapped provider is intended for "request scope" type operations, and allows routines that make redundent ldap calls to be more efficient.

The cache is limited in size, and beyond a specific amount of cache entries, results are moved to a collection using WeakReferences that are subject to garbage collection. This provides some protection against memory leaks.

Only read operations are cached. Performing any operation which may cause a modify (such as ChaiProvider.createEntry(String, String, java.util.Map) or ChaiProvider.writeStringAttribute(String, String, java.util.Set, boolean) ) will cause the cache to be cleared.

There are many ways for this behavior to cause problems. Enabling this setting should be done with caution and extensive testing. In particular, no cache synchronization is performed between providers, which can cause unexpected results if not carefully gaurded against.

Key: chai.cache.enable
Default: false

CACHE_MAXIMUM_SIZE

public static final ChaiSetting CACHE_MAXIMUM_SIZE
Maximum number of cached results to retain in memory.

Key: chai.cache.maximumSize
Default: 128

CACHE_MAXIMUM_AGE

public static final ChaiSetting CACHE_MAXIMUM_AGE
Maximum amount of time to cache results.

Key: chai.cache.maximumAge
Default: 1000

STATISTICS_ENABLE

public static final ChaiSetting STATISTICS_ENABLE
Enable chai statistics. If enabled, each ChaiProvider will maintain statistics and make them available via ChaiProvider.getProviderStatistics().

Default: true

Key: chai.statistics.enable
Default: true

See Also:
ProviderStatistics

WATCHDOG_ENABLE

public static final ChaiSetting WATCHDOG_ENABLE
Enable watchdog idle protection. If this value is set to "true", then the ChaiProvider will automatically close the ldap connection after their has been no activity for some duration of time. If another ldap api is called after the idle connection has caused a close, the ChaiProvider will automatically re-open a new connection using the originally supplied connection settings and credentials.

Note that if this setting is enabled, a lightweight watchdog thread will be running so long as their are any ChaiProvider instances open.

Key: chai.watchdog.enable
Default: true

WATCHDOG_OPERATION_TIMEOUT

public static final ChaiSetting WATCHDOG_OPERATION_TIMEOUT
Maximum time an operation can be in progress (in ms). If this time is exceeded, the connection will be closed. Future ldap api's called to the ChaiProvider will attempt to re-open a new ldap connection.

Key: chai.watchdog.operationTimeout
Default: 60000

WATCHDOG_IDLE_TIMEOUT

public static final ChaiSetting WATCHDOG_IDLE_TIMEOUT
Maximum time a ChaiProvider can remain inactive (in ms). If this time is exceeded, the connection will be closed. Future ldap api's called to the ChaiProvider will attempt to re-open a new ldap connection.

Key: chai.watchdog.idleTimeout
Default: 30000

WATCHDOG_DISABLE_IF_PW_EXPIRED

public static final ChaiSetting WATCHDOG_DISABLE_IF_PW_EXPIRED
The frequency that watchdog timeouts are checked (in ms). The watchdog implementation is only guarenteed to check timeouts at this frequency. This will have a direct impact on the enforcement of timeouts. For example, if the idle timeout is 30 seconds, and the frequency is 30 seconds, then connections may actually be able to remain idle between 30 and 60 seconds.

Note that this setting MUST be set before any ChaiProvider instances are created.

Key: chai.connection.watchdog.frequency
Default: 5000

WATCHDOG_CHECK_FREQUENCY

public static final ChaiSetting WATCHDOG_CHECK_FREQUENCY
The frequency that watchdog timeouts are checked (in ms). The watchdog implementation is only guarenteed to check timeouts at this frequency. This will have a direct impact on the enforcement of timeouts. For example, if the idle timeout is 30 seconds, and the frequency is 30 seconds, then connections may actually be able to remain idle between 30 and 60 seconds.

Note that this setting MUST be set before any ChaiProvider instances are created.

Key: chai.connection.watchdog.frequency
Default: 5000

PROMISCUOUS_SSL

public static final ChaiSetting PROMISCUOUS_SSL
Sets the Chai Provider to use a promiscuous SSL socket factory when making ldaps connections. By default this settings is false, which means that when making an SSL connection, the remote certificate must be trusted by the local JVM keystore.

This setting is intented for use with development environments only, and should not be enabled for production usage.

Key: chai.connection.promiscuousSSL
Default: false

WIRETRACE_ENABLE

public static final ChaiSetting WIRETRACE_ENABLE
Enable wire trace debugging. This will cause all data in/out of chai to be output to the log4j TRACE debug level. This will generate a large volume of debug messages.

WARNING: Enabling this setting will cause all data values to be output to debug mode, including sensitive values such as passwords. Enable this setting with care!

Key: chai.wireDebug.enable
Default: false

FAILOVER_ENABLE

public static final ChaiSetting FAILOVER_ENABLE
Enable fail over when multiple servers are present. Also allows retries to a single server in case of connection problems.

Key: chai.failover.enable
Default: true

FAILOVER_MINIMUM_FAILBACK_TIME

public static final ChaiSetting FAILOVER_MINIMUM_FAILBACK_TIME
Minimum time Chai will wait before retrying a server marked as down. Time is in milliseconds.

Key: chai.failover.failBackTime
Default: 90000

FAILOVER_CONNECT_RETRIES

public static final ChaiSetting FAILOVER_CONNECT_RETRIES
Minimum number of attempts Chai will make to contact a server if there is a communication problem.

Key: chai.failover.connectRetries
Default: 4

LDAP_DEREFENCE_ALIAS

public static final ChaiSetting LDAP_DEREFENCE_ALIAS
Configure alias handling. By default, alias dereferencing is set to "never", so aliases are effectively ignored. Valid settings are the same as those supported by JNDI:
  • always
  • never
  • finding
  • searching
See JNDI alias documentation

Key: chai.ldap.dereferenceAliases
Default: never

LDAP_CONNECT_TIMEOUT

public static final ChaiSetting LDAP_CONNECT_TIMEOUT
Ldap socket timeout, if supported by the ChaiProvider implementation. Time is in milliseconds.

Key: chai.ldap.ldapTimeout
Default: 5000

LDAP_FOLLOW_REFERRALS

public static final ChaiSetting LDAP_FOLLOW_REFERRALS
Enable LDAP referral following. Valid settings are "true" or "false".

Key: chai.ldap.followReferrals
Default: false

PROVIDER_IMPLEMENTATION

public static final ChaiSetting PROVIDER_IMPLEMENTATION
Set the fully qualified class name of the ChaiProvider class name to be used. By default this is the class name for the JNDIProviderImpl class.

Key: chai.provider.implementation
Default: com.novell.ldapchai.provider.JNDIProviderImpl

See Also:
com.novell.ldapchai.provider.JNDIProviderImpl, com.novell.ldapchai.provider.JLDAPProviderImpl

EDIRECTORY_ENABLE_NMAS

public static final ChaiSetting EDIRECTORY_ENABLE_NMAS
Enable NMAS support for Novell eDirectory. NMAS support makes some operations more efficient, and provides more descriptive error messages.

Key: chai.edirectory.enableNMAS
Default: false

EXTENDED_OPERATION_FAILURE_CACHE

public static final ChaiSetting EXTENDED_OPERATION_FAILURE_CACHE
Cache failed operations due to unknown extended operations. Once an unknown extended operation for a given ChaiProvider occurs it will not be retried.

Key: chai.provider.extendedOperation.failureCache
Default: true

READONLY

public static final ChaiSetting READONLY
Set to read-only mode. When enabled, no "write" opertions will be permitted, and will fail with an ChaiOperationException of type ChaiError.READ_ONLY_VIOLATION. This error will also be occured for operations that are only potentially "write" operations such s ChaiProvider.extendedOperation(javax.naming.ldap.ExtendedRequest).

Key: chai.provider.readonly
Default: false

DEFAULT_VENDOR

public static final ChaiSetting DEFAULT_VENDOR
Specify a default directory vendor. If not empty, ChaiProvider implementations should always return the configured value regardless of the actual directory type when ChaiProvider.getDirectoryVendor() is called.

The value must exactly match a known value for ChaiProvider.DIRECTORY_VENDOR.

Default: (blank)

Key: chai.vendor.default
Default: (blank)

JNDI_ENABLE_POOL

public static final ChaiSetting JNDI_ENABLE_POOL

CR_CASE_INSENSITIVE

public static final ChaiSetting CR_CASE_INSENSITIVE
Case insensitive flag. If true, the case of the responses will be ignored when tested. Default is true.

CR_ALLOW_DUPLICATE_RESPONSES

public static final ChaiSetting CR_ALLOW_DUPLICATE_RESPONSES
Allow duplicate response values to be used. Default is false.

CR_DEFAULT_FORMAT_TYPE

public static final ChaiSetting CR_DEFAULT_FORMAT_TYPE
Default Chai CR Format Type. Must be a valid string value of Answer.FormatType

CR_CHAI_STORAGE_ATTRIBUTE

public static final ChaiSetting CR_CHAI_STORAGE_ATTRIBUTE
Setting key to control the ldap attribute name used when reading/writing Chai Challenge/Response formats.

Default: carLicense

See Also:
ChaiResponseSet, ConfigObjectRecord

CR_CHAI_STORAGE_RECORD_ID

public static final ChaiSetting CR_CHAI_STORAGE_RECORD_ID
Setting key to control the COR RecordType used when reading/writing Chai Challenge/Response formats.

Default: 0002

See Also:
ChaiResponseSet, ConfigObjectRecord

CR_CHAI_SALT_COUNT

public static final ChaiSetting CR_CHAI_SALT_COUNT
Setting key to control the number of iterations to perform the CR Salt when the format type is set to Answer.FormatType.SHA1_SALT

Default: 1000

See Also:
ChaiResponseSet, ConfigObjectRecord
